p: Epizootic transmission to horses and humans is mediated by bridge vectors, such as Ochlerotatus melanimon in California, Aedes dorsalis in Utah and New Mexico and A. campestris in New Mexico. The seasonal continuation of the natural WEEV transmission cycle in temperate regions is not clear. However, the annual reintroduction of migratory birds and vertical transmission among A. dorsalis mosquitoes are suspected for the maintenance mechanism in temperate regions [ 81].
